subject: Re: storing test result
msgSnippet: Hi, I usually extend JUnit s TestRunner class and and in my own class manipulate the output the way I want it. TestRunner class has all the basic methods which
messageBody:
Hi,

I usually extend JUnit's TestRunner class and and in my own class
manipulate the output the way I want it. TestRunner class has all the
basic methods which give the output the way it appears in the default
form. I use this option because we have very comprehensive
requirements from different groups using JUnit and I have found this
to be the best way to deal with the problem.

Some people recommend use of 'ant' and some scripting efforts to
achieve the results the way you want it. I have not used that before.
You can look up the archive and get tons of messages and solutions
with respect to this query.

- Nils

--- In junit@y..., infosuresh@s... wrote:
> HAI ,
> I first thank u for responding to my query.
> The thing I want to accomplish is run my test code and store the
results. The storage of results must be part of junit code that
should contain number of tests run,their names, success and failures.
To put in a nutshell, I need to store the output of the junit code
that we obtain after running it.
>
> This is my requirement.i think this must make the
situation pretty clear.
> Thank You & Regards
> Suresh.S
>
